intro: Galium decorum, commonly known as pretty willow or silverweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, creeping stems covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a soft, almost绒-like appearance. Its small, white or pale pink flowers appear in clusters along the stems, often in late spring to early summer. Galium decorum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
